data.text:
We're constantly refining this game project, meaning we're doing a lot of bug fixes and adding new features.
https://github.com/FreezingMoon/AncientBeast/commits/master/?since=2024-04-01&until=2024-05-29

I come from a rather poor family and didn't get the best education along the way, I'm mostly self-educated (web ftw) and have a lot of personal mental and health issues, so your constant support in order to help me bring this to the world is invaluable! <3 Literally, you have no idea! I wouldn't be around here doing this if not for you guys!

I just signed up for Karma (mainly because they offered a little bounty). Seems to me like a great project, will be posting around from time to time to let you guys how things are progressing. There 3 big bottlenecks in order to bring the project to the masses (besides me, lel):

- Biggest one is lack of online multiplayer (we had some tests of this bug there was a show stopping bug that was causing the gameplay to desyncronize between players whenever some movement related ability was being used; the developer that implemented the feature didn't poked at it anymore, even though he got the bounty for the task *sigh*; now the feature is broken altogether and needs to be reimplemented based on new specs, so it was good experience after all but really wish we would get *there* waaaay faster. Road to success is clearly not a straight line...
- second important thing (though many would say the most important one actually) is the lack of bots. Well, AI is the buzzword these days, so just a matter of time I guess as well. I'm more about the people interaction so I'm usually more interested in online (match based) multiplayer games rather than offline games and singleplayer stuff, it's always been like that for me, what can I say? ðŸ»
- unit animations! We've developed a blender addon in order to pre-render 3d unit animations into spritesheets. Problem is that some of the abilities changed around a bit, bigger problem is that it's quite a hard skill to get properly right. A lot of 3d modelers vanished after completing 99% of the work, never getting around tweaking them based on my final feedback. Would have been really great to go this route, but I'm starting to have second thoughts about it for a while now. Another way would be to go the way of Rive and 2d skeleton based animation, which would be way easier to pick up and expand upon, as it's lighter weight asset wise (no huge 3d scuplts and texture files), more modular as creature sprites would be based on parts stacked on a 2d skeleton, easier to have artists and animators dabble together on it, since Rive itself is browser based, device friendlier since you could pick up some tablet and get things going even without a keyboard and so on. Drawback is that Rive is not open source like Blender is, oh well... We can eventually have AI work on 3d version of the game using Blender or something like that, the future is crazy for sure. More important is to get things up and running for now, even if whole pipeline not yet ideal.

So your support to the project will allow us to poke at those 3 things and many more in order to scale things up and have a really great project that is very polished, accessible, lightweight, fun to play and just works really well all around, on pretty much any device and with pretty much any input method that you can think of! ðŸŽ‰
data.title: Hello Karma! Here's what's going on...

data.name: Gitcoin
data.description: Gitcoin creates solutions that empower digitally native communities to fund, build, and protect what matters.

questions.query: Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile associated with previous rounds.
How does your project contribute to the growth of the OSS ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of how your application enhances or expands the current ecosystem.
questions.explanation: This project will hopefully be the go-to game for most people, it already introduces many to making their first open source contribution and even introduces them to crypto and tokens, as even contributions to the project are rewarded with our tokens, so contributing code (fixes, features, optimizations), making game art or even fan art drawings earns you bounties and rewards. How many projects reward their contributors like that? ðŸª™

questions.query: What features or use cases does your dApp/App present? How is it differentiated?
questions.explanation: The game will work on most common devices with lots of input methods and it's designed to be super intuitive, accessible, no account required for the vanilla version, no pay-to-win or pay-to-play stuff either. It appeals to a wide audience, being very well thought out and inclusive. The prototype has been heavily tested and constantly refined / polished over many years now and we'll keep at it while taking things to the next level. Let's make it epic! ðŸº

questions.query: What are your plans for further development, and how will the grant funds be used to achieve these goals?
questions.explanation:
We're aiming for a few major versions each year, each bringing more playable units (3 per release), ability revamps (as we're enhancing them based on testing), UI/UX improvements, new music scores, combat locations and tons of bug fixes and optimizations.

The project currently lacks 3 major things in order to be able to become mainstream, hence the need for some funding:
- online multiplayer (we almost had this one, needs a bit more work now before properly released)
- AI/bots (some people don't have person available to play in hotseat mode so they would like to train by playing versus CPU)
- animations (we'll be going for 3d models and pre-rendered sprites using blender and our custom add-on called Spritify https://github.com/FreezingMoon/Spritify - or go for full 2d route using Rive.app

Eventually the project should generate enough income so that I won't bother you guys anymore ðŸ»

questions.query: What features or use cases does your dApp/App present? How is it differentiated?
questions.explanation: This true eSport is one of the very few replayable games out there that doesn't have any chance based elements!

questions.query: What are your plans for further development, and how will the grant funds be used to achieve these goals?
questions.explanation: We currently have 3 bottlenecks that sort of keep the project "underground"; we pay coding bounties to poke at some major requested features, like online multiplayer and bots to play against. We've had some success with tests so far, but we need improve on that. Also, another important thing after in order to have the project reach mainstream success will be to implement animations for all the creatures and characters, there's some work done on that as well as partnerships. Things are constantly progressing, too bad we're not having some decent funding around to speed things up big time ðŸ» but every bit helps none the less!

questions.explanation: Coming soon when we'll be fixing the current bottlenecks and we'll focus on the web3 parts, starting with wallet integration for user account login and so on.
